sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Jane Doe is being referred for further evaluation and management of persistent fatigue and intermittent low-grade fevers of unknown origin, which have not resolved with initial outpatient interventions.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: Ms. Doe reports experiencing fatigue over the past three months, accompanied by occasional low-grade fevers (maximum 38.2Â°C), mild joint aches, and unintentional weight loss of approximately 3 kg. She denies cough, night sweats, or recent travel. No recent infectious exposures are known. Over-the-counter analgesics have provided minimal relief.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: History is notable for mild asthma, well-controlled with inhalers. No history of autoimmune disease or recent hospitalizations. No known drug allergies.

sections.heading: Assessment
sections.content: The clinical picture raises concern for possible underlying inflammatory or infectious process. Initial laboratory investigations revealed a mild normocytic anemia and elevated C-reactive protein. Chest X-ray and basic metabolic panel were unremarkable.

sections.heading: Plan
sections.content: Referral to General Medicine is requested for further diagnostic workup, including consideration of autoimmune screening, infectious disease panel, and possible imaging studies. Please advise regarding additional investigations or specialist consultations as appropriate.
